meanings.definition: (of an animal) Lying with the body resting on the legs and the head raised.
meanings.sent1: The tired dog was couchant in the shade, enjoying a peaceful nap.
meanings.sent2: The lioness was often seen couchant in the tall grass, watching over her cubs.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked quite couchant on the windowsill, pretending to be a statue.
meanings.sent4: The old tree, with its branches couchant, seemed to embrace the sky above.
meanings.sent5: The rabbit sat couchant in the burrow, ears alert for any danger.

meanings.definition: (of a heraldic beast) Lying down with the head raised.
meanings.sent1: The majestic dragon was depicted couchant on the family crest, symbolizing protection.
meanings.sent2: The griffin was sculpted couchant at the entrance of the castle, guarding the gates.
meanings.sent3: The unicorn statue appeared couchant in the garden, its horn gleaming in the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: The gargoyle perched couchant on the rooftop, overlooking the city below.
meanings.sent5: The mythical creature stood couchant in the painting, its eyes full of mystery.
